statement_text: If you look at the cases that have occurred since 1997, when it [H5N1] first emerged in human cases in Hong Kong, through to mid-2015 to 2016, those years were by far the highest-risk situation. And part of that [the reason for very few human cases] is that the virus has changed—it [the virus]’s mutated to the point of where it is infecting other mammalian species and birds at an increasing rate.
